marklogic.body: I've never been one to dismiss cover art. I'm actually quite proud of my rather immense video game collection. As such, I have so many shelves in my living space that I can't fit a proper bed without having to climb over it so instead I have a futon that I roll up in the morning. Every wall has shelves, with everything from Atari to present packed in them. I still have most of the boxes for all my cart games, and the loose ones all have their own special shelves that I made for them so they don't fall about, especially the N64 games with their very stupid shape. Everything that has come out with proper cases I still have every single one of them. In fact I will not buy games without them. Say I'm purchasing a Dreamcast game on Ebay and it says game disc only, or disc & case no manual, I won't buy it. Â I also never open a game and immediately start playing it. First, I look at the cover. Then I read the blurb on the back. I then open it and look through any inserts. Then I read the manual. Finally I'll play the game. I've been a bookworm, so I Always take the time to fully read and enjoy everything the game has to offer before even turning on the system. Â Now to the actual article. I really like the choices here. I definitely agree with the GTA covers. They're all great, and instantly recognisable. My favorite is Vice City's cover. The only one I'll go ahead and disagree with isÂ Left 4 Dead. While I like simplicity, I find this is too simple. While Heavy Rain's cover piques your interest, and is actually what first got me to even look at the game, Left 4 Dead's in my opinion seems to just be using the popularity of Zombies to try and sell it's game. Â My personal favorites are both from Sega Saturn. Blazing Dragons and NiGHTS into dreams. I was a huge Monty Python fan thanks to my dad, and I remember seeing an advert for Blazing Dragons in the back of one of my Saturn games. I was able to read the words Monty Python but not much else since I couldn't actually read yet, so I got my dad to read it for me. When he told that a guy from Monty Python made the game I instantly fell in love with it, though I have never actually played it. I saw it at my rental shop and the image has forever been Burned into my mind but I have still never bought it. NiGHTS I do have and I think the reason I like the cover so much is because of the nostalgia it inspires. Love that game.
